title: Worked Solution
text:
The slope of a line is given by the formula:
$$slope= rac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$
Plugging in the coordinates given, we get:
$$slope= rac{3-\left(-1ight)}{\left(-5-2ight)}$$
Simplifying, we get:
$$slope= rac{4}{-7}$$
Simplifying further, we get:
$$slope= rac{-4}{7}$$
So the slope of the line that passes through the points $$(2,-1)$$ and $$(-5,3)$$ is $$ rac{-4}{7}$$.
